title: n-Uniform Family
content:
A family F of sets is **n-uniform** if every set in F has exactly n elements.

This is the standard setting for sunflower problems.

title: k-Sunflower (Delta-System)
content:
A **k-sunflower** is a collection of k sets where all pairwise intersections are identical. This common intersection is called the **core**.

Example: {1,2,3}, {1,4,5}, {1,6,7} form a 3-sunflower with core {1}.
mathContext: Also called a delta-system. The petals are the sets minus the core.

title: Contains Sunflower
content:
A family **contains a k-sunflower** if some subset of k sets forms a sunflower.

The Sunflower Lemma guarantees large families always contain sunflowers.

title: Sunflower Number f(n,k)
content:
f(n,k) = minimum m such that every n-uniform family of size m contains a k-sunflower.

This is the central quantity in the Sunflower Conjecture.

title: Sunflower Number is Finite
content:
f(n,k) exists and is finite for all n and k >= 2.

This is the content of the Erdős-Rado Sunflower Lemma.

title: Erdős-Rado Lemma (1960)
content:
**Original bound:** f(n,k) <= (k-1)^n * n!

This was the first quantitative sunflower result. The n! factor is what the conjecture aims to eliminate.
mathContext: Proved by induction on n. The key insight is that either we find a sunflower or we can reduce to smaller sets.

title: Sunflower Conjecture (OPEN)
content:
**Main Conjecture:** For each k >= 3, there exists c_k > 0 such that f(n,k) < c_k^n.

This asks if the n! factor in Erdős-Rado can be completely removed. Prize: $1,000.

title: The k=3 Case
content:
Erdős said 'the whole difficulty' is in k=3. The $1,000 prize is specifically for this case.

Solving k=3 would likely give techniques for general k.

title: Kostochka (1997)
content:
**First improvement:** f(n,k) = o(n!) * (k-1)^n.

Kostochka won a $100 consolation prize for being the first to improve on Erdős-Rado.

title: ALWZ Bound (2020)
content:
**Major breakthrough:** f(n,k) <= (Ck log n log log n)^n.

Alweiss, Lovett, Wu, and Zhang reduced the bound from n! to (log n)^n growth - a massive 60-year improvement.

title: Rao Bound (2020)
content:
**Current best:** f(n,k) <= (Ck log n)^n.

Rao removed one log factor from ALWZ using coding-theoretic ideas. This is the state of the art.

title: Required Bound
content:
The conjecture requires f(n,k) <= c^n for some constant c.

Current best has (log n)^n extra factor. Removing this factor is 'the last barrier'.

title: Gap Description
content:
**Equivalence:** The sunflower conjecture is equivalent to achieving the required bound for all k >= 3.

This formalizes what remains to be proved.

title: k=2 Case
content:
f(n,2) = n+1 exactly. Any n+2 sets of size n must have two that overlap.

This easy case shows the difficulty is in k >= 3.

title: Lower Bound
content:
f(n,k) >= (k-1)^n. There exist n-uniform families of size (k-1)^n with no k-sunflower.

The conjecture asks if this lower bound is essentially tight.

title: Problem Status: OPEN
content:
**Erdős Problem #20 remains OPEN** with a $1,000 prize.

The law of excluded middle gives us SunflowerConjecture or its negation, but we don't know which!
